title: Twitter Is Said to Have Struggled Over Revealing US Influence Campaign
description: Internal emails showed the company’s communications with the Pentagon over a network of military-run accounts.

title: FTX Co-Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Released on $250 Million Bond
description: The disgraced cryptocurrency executive appeared in court in Manhattan after his extradition from the Bahamas last night. He was granted bail and will live with his parents in California.

title: ByteDance Inquiry Finds Employees Obtained User Data of 2 Journalists
description: The company’s internal investigation showed that workers also obtained data on a small number of other U.S. users.

title: YouTube Reaches Deal for N.F.L. Sunday Ticket
description: Tech giants including Apple, Amazon and YouTube’s owner, Google, pursued the rights to stream the N.F.L. games.

title: Musk Lifted Bans for Thousands on Twitter. Here’s What They’re Tweeting.
description: Many reinstated users are tweeting about topics that got them barred in the first place: Covid-19 skepticism, election denialism and QAnon.

title: Microsoft Gambles on ‘Nice Guy’ Strategy to Close Activision Megadeal
description: Federal regulators have sued to block the $69 billion acquisition, but the company has settled on a path forward and is preparing to force the issue.

title: Two Executives in Sam Bankman-Fried’s Crypto Empire Plead Guilty to Fraud
description: Caroline Ellison, the former chief executive of Alameda Research, and Gary Wang, a founder of FTX, are cooperating in the federal criminal case against Mr. Bankman-Fried.
